result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Lee Ritchey was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked, any sentence ordered will be ordered consecutive to all other sentences.

miscConds.notes:
1) The court waived all other court costs and assessed only the DNA surcharge in this matter.
2) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
3) The defendant shall pay at a rate of $50 per month to probation; first payment is due October 1, 2022.
4) If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
The defendant must complete an AODA and comply with any treatment that may be recommended.

1) The defendant shall undergo a mental health evaluation and follow through with all recommendations.
2) The defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.
3) The defendant shall undergo regular drug testing.
The defendant shall maintain gainful employment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Lee Ritchey

defendant.name: Ritchey, Ronald Lee

records.addlTxt:
9:03 AM Cases 21CF181 and 22CF91 called together.  Defendant Ronald Lee Ritchey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Ronald Lee Ritchey.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Def waives in person hearing KIV.  Off the record 9:04 am.  Back on the record 9:04 AM, same appearances as previously noted.  Case is on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Davis: defendant will plead to 2 amended counts of misdemeanor possession of amphetamine and 1 count of drug paraphernalia (amended Count 1 of 21CF181, Count 2 of either 22CF91 or 21CF181, and amended Ct 1 22CF91); joint rec for probation and a withheld sentence.  117 days jail credit stipulated to.  State moves to amend Count 1 of both 21CF181 and 22CF91 to possession of amphetamine (Misdemeanor); Court grants.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. 
 Def enters a plea of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 of 21CF181, Count 1 of 22CF91, and Count 2 of 21CF181 and orders a JOC; remaining counts are DRI.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement.  Def makes a statement to the Court.  
Court orders: 
21CF181, Count 1- 5 months jail, good time eligible, 117 days jail credit; $200
21CF181, Count 2- 30 days jail, concurrent to Ct 1, good time eligible; $200
22CF91, Count 1- 1 year probation, if revoked, consecutive to any other sentence; $200
Mental health evaluation and follow through.  Take all medications as prescribed.  AODA assessment and follow through.  Regular drug testing.  Gainful employment.  
$50/payments to probation, to begin October 1st.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.  Report to probation immediately upon release from custody.
Letter to Judge re: proposed jail credit
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:40 AM Cases 21C181 and 22CF91 called together.  Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald Lee Ritchey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Ronald Lee Ritchey. Case on for Status Conference.  Off the record discussion was held RE: offers.  Defense attorney updates the Court: def accepting an offer to plead to 3 misdemeanors (2 possession of amphetamine charges and a drug paraphernalia).
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:24 PM Cases 21CF181 and 22CF91 called together. Prosecuting attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald Lee Ritchey appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis appeared by video for Ronald Lee Ritchey.  Case is on for preliminary hearing.  Def waives in person appearance KIV.  State calls first witness, Deputy Bailey Mangen, who is sworn in and testifies.  State asks Court to take judicial notice of 21CF181 and the bail bond therein.  Witness has identified the defendant.  Venue is made.  Atty Davis crosses.  State objects- speculative; atty Davis responds, State objects, also beyond the scope; Court allows.  State objects, beyond the scope, sustained.  Off the record 2:35 PM (def drops off Zoom call).  Back on the record 2:38 PM, same appearances as previously noted.  Cross continues.  State redirects.  No recross.  State rests, asks for bind over.  Witness is released.  Atty Davis stands mute.  Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and the defendant probably committed it.  The matter is bound over for further proceedings.  The State files information mirroring complaint.   Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts. State recites his latest offer: Plead to Cts 1 and 3 22CF91, DRI balance, parties free to argue.  Atty Davis notes counter offer sent; State rejects.
Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on June 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

11:21 AM 22CF91 and 21CF181 called together.  Defendant Ronald Lee Ritchey in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis by video.  Defendant in custody.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Case was on for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  However, no initial done in 22CF91.   Atty Davis advises there was a global offer if he waives PH in 22CF91, pleads guilty to Ct 1 & 3 and DRI remainder and both sides free to argue.   Court will set this for PH.   Initial in 22F91.    Case on for an Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Enters NG to misd.  Discussion regarding waiving time limits.  Defendant/Attorney Davis waive time limits.  Atty Davis may appear by video.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:08 PM Called 21CF181 & 22CF91 for STC.  Attorney Nicholas Von Davis in court.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person.  Def in Polk Co Jail, not appearing right now, has another 2pm in Barron Co.  Off the record Attny wished to schedule PLEAS.  Attny Davis recited the offer received on 4/14, reduce to possession of amphetamine, DRI rest, DNA costs and fees.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.

[Clerked by ATROMBE]
Plea hearing on May 16, 2022 at 11:15 am.

The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant must contact Tessa Anderson to learn about A.A.
